abstract: White House Letter; Pres Obama repeatedly invokes phrase '65-member coalition' in discussing allies against Islamic State, while in practice only about dozen countries have contributed to actual fighting; experts consider primarily political benefits of having Obama administration repeatedly cite broader international support, including heightening awareness that Russia is acting outside any coalition.
lead_paragraph: President Obama has sought to make clear that the United States is not alone in its fight against the Islamic State, though some members of an often-cited coalition may be doing less than others.

headline.main: A Coalition in Which Some Do More Than Others to Fight ISIS
headline.print_headline: A Coalition 65 Nations Strong, but Few Willing to Strike ISIS

snippet: President Obama has sought to make clear that the United States is not alone in its fight against the Islamic State, though some members of an often-cited coalition may be doing less than others.
